description._content: TITLE Winchester Street Bridge, Keene NH CREATOR SUBJECT Bridges - NH - Keene Rivers - NH - Keene Covered bridges - NH - Keene DESCRIPTION Photograph of the Winchester Street Bridge in Keene New Hampshire, built in 1851 and removed in 1910. "It was built in 1851 by Moses Howard, father of the late O.J. Howard, and was removed July 12, 1910, but owing to delay experienced in receiving the new bridge it was out for something like five months. People on foot crossed the river on a narrow span thrown across a little to the south. One of its truss pins in preserved in the collections of the Historical Society of Cheshire County. The bridge was replaced by the present iron structure." PUBLISHER Keene Public Library DATE DIGITAL 20071121 DATE ORIGINAL RESOURCE TYPE photographs FORMAT image/jpg RESOURCE IDENTIFIER hsykbrg021 RIGHTS MANAGMENT No known restriction on publication.
